content: jonathan s hat by anne kubelik a quickly knit beanie in bulky yarn if you want a smaller or larger size increase or decrease the cast on stitches by 6 and adjust length to make a turned-up brim make the ribbing 4 5-5 11 5-13 cm long sizes adult s/m adult m/l materials yarn 100g knitpicks swish bulky or any bulky yarn needles size 10 6 mm circular needles 16 40 mm long or length needed for magic loop size 10 6 mm double pointed needles if needed marker gauge in row 1-4 of body 20 st and 28 row = 4 10 cm glossary sl1wyib = slip_stitch purlwise with yarn in back sl1wyif = slip_stitch purlwise with yarn in front instructions cast on 72 78 stitches using a stretchy cast on method like german twist join being careful to not twist stitches place marker ribbing row 1 k1 p1 repeat until end of the row row 2 sl1wyib p1 repeat until end of the row repeat these two rounds until ribbing is 2 5 cm long body row 1 and 3 k1 p1 repeat until end of the row row 2 sl1wyif p1 repeat until end of the row row 4 sl1wyib p1 repeat until end of the row repeat these 4 rounds 5 6 more times then repeat row 1 and 2 once decrease if not using magic loop change to dpns as needed row 1 ssk k1 p1 k1 p1 repeat until end of the row 60 65 stitches on needle row 2 sl1wyib k1 p1 k1 p1 repeat until end of the row row 3 ssk p1 k1 p1 repeat until end of the row 48 52 stitches on needle row 4 sl1wyib p1 k1 p1 repeat until end of the row row 5 ssk k1 p1 repeat until end of the row 36 39 stitches on needle row 6 sl1wyib k1 p1 repeat until end of the row row 7 ssk p1 repeat until end of the row 24 26 stitches on needle row 8 ssk repeat until end of the row 12 13 stitches on needle row 9 ssk repeat until end of the row for size m/l knit last stitch 6 7 stitches on needle break yarn leaving a tail pull through remaining stitches weave in ends on wrong side
